revised_title: Infrared Spectrum and Intensities of Benzene and Deuterated Derivatives
tldr: The authors measured the intensities of the infrared active fundamental vibrations of benzene, monodeuterobenzene, and para-dideuterobenzene. They interpreted the results in terms of the dipole moment derivatives and found that the effective C-H bond moment for in-plane bending is different from that for out-of-plane bending. The study provides insight into the nature of carbon-hydrogen bonds in hydrocarbons.
